subject: Medicine
title: CAR-T Cell Therapy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on CAR-T Cell Therapy.

hook.text: Doctors took a dying girl's T cells, engineered them in a lab, and put them back. Her cancer vanished.

buildup.text: CAR-T therapy genetically modifies a patient's own T cells to recognize and attack their specific cancer.

discovery.text: The engineered cells multiply inside the body, hunting cancer cells with precision no drug can match.

twist.text: CAR-T can trigger severe side effects‚Äîcytokine storms so intense they require ICU care.

climax.text: Despite risks, CAR-T has produced complete remissions in cancers that resisted all other treatments.

punchline.text: Your own cells, reprogrammed, became the cure.

quiz.question: What makes CAR-T therapy unique in cancer treatment?
options: It uses the patient's own genetically modified immune cells
It completely replaces the immune system
It uses synthetic antibodies from a lab
